humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a maximum microscopic tumor diameter of 4.0 cm, which falls under the T2 category (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). However, the report also mentions 'massive subepidermal carcinomatous lymphangitis of the skin spindle' which suggests direct extension to the skin (T4). But since the exact size of this involvement is not specified, we cannot definitively classify it as T4. Therefore, based on the largest tumor size, the T stage is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report mentions that the maximum spread of the tumor is 8 cm, which puts it in the T3 category. The T3 category includes tumors that have spread to the chest wall or skin, as indicated by the presence of 'massive subepidermal carcinomatous lymphangitis of the skin spindle.' Therefore, the T stage from this report is T3.
